channel.title: Protocol swapping?
channel.description: I just would like to know if this is possible. Let's say if you had an edited client. The client could read a 317 and a 562 server. A friend of mine is wanting to create a world for a 317 and a 562 and he is trying to figure this out. Is it possible for a client to read both protocols?

item.title: Protocol swapping?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Loveandpower:

I just would like to know if this is possible. Let’s say if you had an edited client. The client could read a 317 and a 562 server. A friend of mine is wanting to create a world for a 317 and a 562 and he is trying to figure this out. Is it possible for a client to read both protocols?

Short answer: Yes and no.

It will require a lot more processing to be done by the server.

You would have to add the 562 protocol to the 317 client, and the 317 protocol to the 562 client.

You will have to account for the differences in items, object, and npcs.

You will have to account for the differences in the maps. (eg. the fountain in varrock).

Read full topic
